title.narrative: OUTPUT 3.A: EDUCATION ACCESS

description.narrative: Output 3.1: The most vulnerable children have equitable access to basic learning opportunities (Access), which contributes to Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Improved access for girls and boys in targeted communities to equitable and inclusive education opportunities of good quality

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 3.1: The most vulnerable children have equitable access to basic learning opportunities (Access)

description.narrative: In 2020, UNICEF supported access to education opportunities to 414,322 conflict-affected children (48 per cent girls), through rehabilitation of schools and WASH facilities, provision of learning materials and school furniture; the conduct of grade 9 and 12 exams was supported for 455,606 children (48 per cent girls). | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:17/01/2021
